website_summaries.verdict: A simplified, but smartly-designed lift with a huge list of applications.
pros: This jack may look basic, but its crank operation and wide platform grant impressive versatility and dependability
It can fit with most motorcycles weighing 1,100 pounds or less
Wears an attractive blue and black powder-coated finish
Best of all, it doesn't break the bank
cons: The hand crank design may become tiring to use, and the unit isn’t robust enough to handle very heavy bikes

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't even trust a trycile on this lift. You can see in the video that the whole thing rocks back and forth. Your bike could easily fall off. Very unsturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Steady and safe
customer_reviews.text: Works well for the size. My Kawasaki Vulcan 1600 Classic was fairly steady while I pulled the front and rear wheels off. I did, however, put a bottle jack under the rear trailing arm to balance it after raising with the liftmaster
customer_reviews.author: Gregthefisherman

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S.
customer_reviews.text: Damn thing broke the first time I used it! Parts went flying and $30K bike came crashing down. Managed to catch it before it tipped over, but I'm sure I'll have a chiropractor bill come Monday because of it. Piece of S%&T. Wouldn't trust it with a bicycle. Whole thing held together with one roll pin.
customer_reviews.author: scottg69

customer_reviews.title: good investment
customer_reviews.text: Great initial quality, nice wide stance more stable then the others I've owed. I had one more $$ with wigs that were suppose to act as stabilizers not very good at that. This is a wide body felt good about lifting 950lb bike. The pad on top has lasted longer then the last one on other models. Definitely worth the $$
customer_reviews.author: road glide

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding product!! Get yours today!!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Just perfect. Heavy duty work of art that works great. Great buy, great price. Just perfect. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: TMB

customer_reviews.title: Decent jack for decent price
customer_reviews.text: Decent quality. I could see some heavier duty materials making this amazing. Flexes quite a bit when lifting 500 lb bike for front wheel service but is quite stable. Threaded rod and bearing I assume will be first thing to fail. Do NOT use an impact gun on these. A ratchet and 7/8" sockets works just fine. This was a great addition to my full size motorcycle stand. Works great on our dirt bikes too.
customer_reviews.author: Diego R.

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Lifts my Iron 883 with ease. Came in handy when installing my sissy bar. I had to get my hand under the fender to hold a nut. Lifted the bike and the rear tire dropped down. Very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Simulink

customer_reviews.title: This works great for my Triumph
customer_reviews.text: This works great for my Triumph. Plenty of clearance, could be used for many bikes. I used to change the oil and install new rear springs. A must have for anyone who works on their own bike.
customer_reviews.author: Luke-NY

customer_reviews.title: BLUE motorcycle jack
customer_reviews.text: This truly makes servicing my Suzuki Marauder a breeze. Comes with a socket with lever, but using a socket ratchet will be faster. Glad I bought it. Reasonable price and I like the color. My bike only weighs 415 pounds so it is ideal for minor repairs, service and cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: THECOFFEEMAN

customer_reviews.title: Decent lift.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Deck padding gets torn up fairly easily if pressed against any protruding hardware though. *Update The adhesive holding the deck pad to the jack became useless after coming in contact with motor oil, and now my bike easily slides around on said jack while it is elevated off the ground. Not cool. If this becomes the case for you, be sure to keep your side stand down, and be careful about how you apply force to anything on your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Trinity

customer_reviews.title: Buy If You Want To Drop Your Bike
customer_reviews.text: I used this product a handful of times without any issues. Today, the safety pin fell out which is the only thing keeping the jack up. My bike nearly smacked the ground. I had to use my body to keep it from hitting. I cannot even get a hold on the manufacturer to inquire about warranty. When you search for LiftMaster online, all they sell is garage door openers. I tried to chat and call their customer service and they are denying that they even make motorcycle jacks. Awesome...
customer_reviews.author: Karah

customer_reviews.title: Works well for my KLR 650
customer_reviews.text: Tried a center stand and no dice with my 400lb bike. Got this and it hoists my bike no problem. As some have mentioned there is a little wobble. I imagine if you got closer to the weight limit with a big bike it might be less than ideal. For my KLR 650 it works great. For a little added stability you can put a jack stand under the front fork or run a ratchet strap to your rafters and the handlebars.
customer_reviews.author: Shane Mabrey

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine
customer_reviews.text: If you want some industrial strength jack to lift your MC a couple of feet off the ground then spend the bucks. But for less than $70 this jack works just fine. Sure it lacks in stability when fully extended but what jack doesn't. Just use some 2X4's or 4X4's to take up the need for extension and it's as stable as you need for basic work. It's also compact and stores easily. Might be a bit of a challenge for a fully loaded Goldwing etc. I have a KLR.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Starrett

customer_reviews.title: GREAT FOR SMAll ENDUROS
customer_reviews.text: The bike I used this on weighs approximately 240 pounds, 1978 Kawasaki KE 175. This lift held this bike reasonably well. Even though I centered the bike well, it’s still leaned on the jack. I WOULD NOT LIFT ANYTHING MORE THAN 300lbs. That might even be stretching it.
customer_reviews.author: Buzzirdbait

customer_reviews.title: You might need two.
customer_reviews.text: It works well and is capable of lifting a HD road King, however it's not wide enough to keep it stable. I bought a second one and together they work well. Also the had crank that comes with is not much help. Works much better with an impact and a 7/8 socket.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: Best priced jack around
customer_reviews.text: I shopped and shopped around for an inexpensive reliable and durable moto jack. I only need this for oil changes and occasional maintenance so did not want to spend a lot for occasional use. Could not be happier. Best priced jack I found and with Prime it was a no brainer.
customer_reviews.author: Doc

customer_reviews.title: Great bike lift for not a lot of money
customer_reviews.text: I have lifted both of my bikes 2004 Suzuki DR650 and 1982 Honda GL1100 Goldwing with no problems. I just slide it under and crank it up. Maybe they bike could fall off if you were shaking it but it seems pretty stable. Its not a bunch of money and its blue! Cant beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Saul Curson

customer_reviews.title: I use it on my Road King
customer_reviews.text: I use this to service my 2017 Road King, a very heavy bike. I have not had any problems with it all. It's very stable and stores nicely under my tool bench.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: works fine, cost effective.
customer_reviews.text: I actually used this to jack up a 48" natural gas range so that we could put casters under the legs and wheel it out. Worked great. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: K. Fischer

customer_reviews.title: Collapsed with my Harley on it
customer_reviews.text: This thing broke while I was lowing my bike and it came crashing down. Luckily I had read other bad reviews of similar things happening so I was holding the bike just in case. I only bought this to tide me over until my J&S Jacks one arrives. Cannot recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: I used it for my 79 Yamaha
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Nice and compact. It beats having a full size lift taking up lots of room
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Good lift
customer_reviews.text: Good lift. Good price. No issues lifting my HD Road King. Depending how you balance it you get front, rear or both wheels up. Also, I couldn't find it anywhere, so I measured it; the nut is 22mm if you want to use a socket wrench.
customer_reviews.author: bikerD

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a fatboy
customer_reviews.text: I've used this lifting the front, back, and center of a 2003 fatboy. This lifts with no issue and is very stable when used properly.
customer_reviews.author: R. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I used it to lift my harley street glide. It's a 800lb bike, lifted it really easy by myself, it feels very stable.
customer_reviews.author: David Krocker

customer_reviews.title: Dont use an impact if you want it to last
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for a while, ised my impact to raise and lower it even tho it says not to.. eventually that lead to the threads stripping.. worked great before that.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: You’ll need a large socket for this but that’s perfect if you got the drill. Easy up and easy down with a drill. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Robles

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Yamaha bolt
customer_reviews.text: Works great for my Yamaha bolt. Low enough to fit under my bike and easy to use. Love this jack !!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Made of good quality steel
customer_reviews.text: This jack works bets with a socket and a ratchet together and gives you better control.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin McIntyre

customer_reviews.title: Overall, loose
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of side to side motion with this lift. It is good for the money, however, you can rock it back and forth quite a bit.. It will work in a pinch, but I wouldn't put my Ultra on it and go to pulling tires off or leaving it there for any period of time.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: its junk
customer_reviews.text: I used this jack 4 times since I bought in in Sept. And its stripped out. I was going up and was half way up and it got stripped out and my customers bike nearly fell on me. I want a refund or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: uncle ron

customer_reviews.title: Works good
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty unit. Lifting my bike up off the ground, it got tipsy.
customer_reviews.author: Rubble

customer_reviews.title: Pretty sturdy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap and we'll built. Good for smaller bikes like 800cc and smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and stable
customer_reviews.text: Got this so I could tighten the chain on my motorcycle. Easy to use and makes the job easier
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I've received 2 faulty lifts from this company. Go with the higher priced version from another company. This one is cheap and unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Preston yockeman

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Works great and like it should. Easy to raise and lower
customer_reviews.author: Btalbert89

customer_reviews.title: Worked well on my 48
customer_reviews.text: Left this Jack for 3 days with my 48 lifted above ground. It is very easy to use and had no issues at all when it lefted my bike for 3 days. Good lift for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Conrado

customer_reviews.title: better than  i expected
customer_reviews.text: The thing was rock solid. Was able to take apart rear hub.
customer_reviews.author: paratrooper4life

customer_reviews.title: it lifed my ktm 790 like it was nothing
customer_reviews.text: to hold it upright for maintenance. like chain adjust etc nice job.
customer_reviews.author: xenduro

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to work on my DR650 which is heavy enough that I couldn't use my kick operated stand for my dirtbike. This stand is light enough to move around easy and will lift the bike pretty quick. Sturdy and well made.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Lifts a bike well I even used it on my car
customer_reviews.author: Dominik

customer_reviews.title: Great scissor lift!
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. No problem at all lifting my Road King or Dyna.
customer_reviews.author: Brad McCarty

customer_reviews.title: husband loves it
customer_reviews.text: I don't use it myself but he loves it so that works for me.
customer_reviews.author: Chief

customer_reviews.title: thanks for a great product
customer_reviews.text: great lift for the money. able to do oil changes on my Indian Chieftain without worry.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gilles

customer_reviews.title: Solid piece of equipment
customer_reviews.text: Got this to get the load off my tires for winter storage. Easy to use and seems pretty sturdy for my needs. I’m sure it’ll come in handy for maintenance. Wish I would have bought one sooner.
customer_reviews.author: JM

customer_reviews.title: Too hard to work
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had spent the money to get a more easily usable lift for my bike. This one is very difficult to use and takes a long time to get the bike centered and lifted appropriately. Spend the money to get a better one.
customer_reviews.author: Cantrell Insurance

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for my purposes.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Lifts my Vulcan Voyager just fine. I would recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: BlackDogTX

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Use a drill to lift my 2006 Harley Electra glide. Feels real solid and he a small footprint. So far happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.author: Wes

customer_reviews.title: Great lift
customer_reviews.text: Served its purpose. Sturdy wide base ease of use. I would recommend this
customer_reviews.author: James Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.text: Small and compact but very sturdy and works very well for what we need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: solid, speeds lifting bike
customer_reviews.text: lift your bike while on your table lift, use another to raise and lower wheels. Put a socket on your DeWalt drill and this gets really quick!
customer_reviews.author: 2Km High Shootist

customer_reviews.title: Good for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Just what I needed, I have a 2007 Electra glide classic and this had no problem lifting it and stabilizing it so that I could change the front tire and clean the bike.
customer_reviews.author: GFPD

customer_reviews.title: Broken
customer_reviews.text: Bolt stripped and lift failed. Not even 2 months old. DO NOT BUY
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: great for the money
customer_reviews.text: Very heavy duty, well balanced with a load. (street glide)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Supplied in time as listed, Easy to use and well made, highly recommended, shipping was extremely easy and all items arrived as described.
customer_reviews.author: Juan E. Ariza

customer_reviews.title: Great well built excellent product
customer_reviews.text: To be honest not sure how I worked on bikes for over 20 year with out one it's my go to I find my self putting bike on it just to sit. Can't brag enough about it going to be buying 2 more for other bikes
customer_reviews.author: daniel kerr

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I use it to lift my Raptor 700 ATV. Works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Stan

customer_reviews.title: Stable jack
customer_reviews.text: Flat top good stability, had to make a fixture to raise my bike evenly,good product
customer_reviews.author: Allison T.

customer_reviews.title: Great lift for the cash!
customer_reviews.text: Well constructed, and holds my bike well. Definitely would buy another if this one fails!
customer_reviews.author: Steven Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Very stable
customer_reviews.text: I love this lift it keeps my bike verry stable while I'm wrenching around on it
customer_reviews.author: Ian K Winter

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: Decent lift for occasional use for smaller motorcycles and ATVS. Not a good lift for everyday use in a shop. And not good for heavy motorcycles and ATVS. Will spend the extra money for a better lift next time.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen N Hopkins

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Would gave it 5 stars if it qher wider. But over all a good buy.
customer_reviews.author: Big Dave

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: Great jack, very low price and had no issues lifting my 2019 road king.
customer_reviews.author: Scott P.

customer_reviews.title: For the money its great
customer_reviews.text: Its wide supports my Fatboy I don't raise it to full height no need too but I believe it would be stable
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Liftmaster Lift
customer_reviews.text: The thrust bearing on the screw that raises the device failed within 10 minutes of use on less than 450 lbs. Maybe the vendor will send me a new one.
customer_reviews.author: ALLEN HILL

customer_reviews.title: Handle positioning sucks
customer_reviews.text: kinda awkward handle to open and close. i ended up returning it for something that operates more smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: Best deal ever!
customer_reviews.text: For a lower cost item, this product out preforms my $250 motorcycle maintenance stand!
customer_reviews.author: lisa price

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: works just fine. Besides a motorcycle jack I used as an auto tyranny jack
customer_reviews.author: Gr8ghost

customer_reviews.title: it works real easy
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used it a lot but it's very easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: James  McAdams

customer_reviews.title: Great product A+
customer_reviews.text: Works great on my 09 ultra classic, I lowered my bike so a regular jack will not work but this one is great , very sturdy
customer_reviews.author: james sewell

customer_reviews.title: Lacking in stability
customer_reviews.text: Lifts my bike ok, but it tilts when the weight is on it. Good for a quick clean of the wheels but I don’t trust it to leave my bike up on it. Not sturdy enough to be trusted holding up my bike overnight.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Merrill

customer_reviews.title: Bike safety
customer_reviews.text: I liked how wide it is, because when you lift your harley off the floor its sturdy enough that you don't have to worry about it tipping over.
customer_reviews.author: Stanley Terry

customer_reviews.title: Strong and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly and very sturdy. I was comfortable working on my bike (VTX 1300) even on the street in NYC.
customer_reviews.author: Del V

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Works well. Couldn't have completed a project on my Honda shadow w/out it.
customer_reviews.author: The Big O

customer_reviews.title: Worked great
customer_reviews.text: Lifted my Yamaha Road Star1600 for a rear tire change, rock solid on the stand. Great for once a year Moto jacking.
customer_reviews.author: John S Hudson

customer_reviews.title: Works great. I’m happy with the product
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly as described. Have a project bike up on it now. No issues.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Harley Davidson motorcycle Jack
customer_reviews.text: Quality product for the money and a lot less than competitors
customer_reviews.author: James H Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: POS. Broke the 1st time I used it. Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Clayton J. Olsen

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Lift is small and compact. Can be used with flat bottom motorcycles. Product is well built, strudy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbob Motoducati

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: The lift worked great. Lifted my Road King easily. Was very stable.
customer_reviews.author: robert perkins

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great lift for the price, lifts my 06 ultra classic easily
customer_reviews.author: Chris C.

customer_reviews.title: Motorcycle lift
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t have rollers and not easy to raise. Will return and look for something else
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: return
customer_reviews.text: did not use. way to unstable for my bike. please send return information. thank you
customer_reviews.author: David Langley

customer_reviews.title: Dont strip the screw
customer_reviews.text: Where can i get a replacement screw? As its stripped and wont go up
customer_reviews.author: George M.

customer_reviews.title: Look no further!
customer_reviews.text: Smartest investment for a bike owner. Very compact and works far better than expected. Priced right.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Ryan

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: Jack didn't last 6 months and broke. Would not recommend buying.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar E. Rodgers Jr

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: nice to work on a bike on a stand for once. 1100 vstar
customer_reviews.author: Dtownbikes

customer_reviews.title: Very nice lift
customer_reviews.text: Very impressed with the size and how lightweight the lift is. Worth every penny
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: almost love it, not sure how long this will last ...
customer_reviews.text: almost love it, not sure how long this will last for the cost difference this might not have been the best bu. but then I only have one bike and this serves as an emergency option to be able to fix some thing at home before being able to get help
customer_reviews.author: Baner

product_meta.title: liftmaster 1100 LB Wide Deck Motorcycle Center Scissor Lift Jack Hoist Stand Bikes ATVs
feature_bullets: Solid steel construction in a blue and black powder coated finish
Designed to fit most motorcycle models
For use in the garage, shop, or at the track
